ovdesc.p: This table defines the conditions that would be used for SL module. Accounting of the module would be guided based on definition of this table. Here, the user may specify transaction codes, the accrual cycle and other accounting rules for the module.
The key to this file can only accept a valid COMPANY.CODE.

SL.MSG.CLASS and EB.MSG.CLASS are used to formulate the class mapping between SL internal class and EB.MESSAGE.CLASS. The main driving concept of ACTIVITY and CLASS has lend itself to facilitate the user by automatically trigger only the message related to the operation, which user currently do. In a sense, the system will try to default a sensible CLASS tiding to corresponding activity, and populate the information on the SL transaction. Consequently, the user can take control of the class to choose whether he/she wants to produce as per suggestion by the system.
The following types are valid types:
GRANT NEW FACILITY, GRANT NEW FACILITY.BORR

Field to indicate the maximum amount that could be adjusted while handling SL.ROUND.ADJ. A value in this field could be provided to eliminate input errors by users while doing SL.ROUND.ADJ
Maximum allowed value is 5.

This check is performed for all participants, excluding T24 bank. The validation for T24 bank is performed selectively, only while doing adjustment downwards. For adjustment upwards, this validation is not done in order to accommodate skimming adjustments.
For more details see overview on SL.ROUND.ADJ
Optional input. If no input is made no adjustments would be permitted in SL.ROUND.ADJ
Maximum value allowed is 5. No decimals allowed
Category code to which skim amounts are to be accounted.
In certain syndicates the rate (commitment fee/interest) charged to the borrower and the rates applicable to the participants could differ. The difference is skimmed by the Agent.
This field specifies the internal account category code to which such skimmed portion is to be accounted.

When AUTOMATIC is chosen a the Liquidation.Mode the rounding differences are parked in this account. For example the customer pays 100 which is to be shared 1/3 between three participants. The share of each participant is 33.33 and hence the difference of 0.01 is accounted to the account in this field in order to keep the system in sync. The agent could then decide to either credit this amount to his P&L or pay it to the relevant participant to whom it is due.
Must be within the category range 10000 - 19999
Must be a valid record on CATEGORY table
Mandatory input

Field is used to help prevent errors through mis-keying the adjustment amounts>

Entering NO here will bypass these checks
